question: Is lumican a secreted protein?
ideal_answer: Yes, Lumican is a secreted proteoglycan that regulates collagen fibril assembly.

snippets.text: fibroblasts stimulated with the fibrocyte-secreted inflammatory signal tumor necrosis factor-α secrete the small leucine-rich proteoglycan lumican
TNF-α-stimulated fibroblasts secrete lumican to promote fibrocyte differentiation.
Secreted 70kDa lumican stimulates growth and inhibits invasion of human pancreatic cancer.
the elevated level of lumican secretion to extracellular space leads to actin cytoskeletal remodeling followed by an increase in migration capacity of human colon LS180 cells
Lumican is a secreted proteoglycan that regulates collagen fibril assembly.
This is the first time that the synthesis and secretion of lumican in human melanoma cell lines is reported.
